newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: PRESS DIGEST - S.Korean newspapers - April 14.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - S.Korean newspapers - April 14.

text.p: The following is a summary of major stories in leading South Korean newspapers, prepared by Reuters in Seoul. Reuters has not checked the stories and does not guarantee their accuracy.

- Prosecutors said they will summon Rep. Kim Yoon-whan, a high ranking member of the ruling New Korea Party, and three others today for questioning on suspicions they had received money from the failed Hanbo Group.
- Chung Bo-keun is due to testify before a parliamentary hearing probing a loans scandal on Monday.

- The ruling camp is discussing a date to grant amnesty to former presidents Chun Doo Whan and Roh Tae-woo who are guilty of treason, mutiny and bribery. They were sentenced to life in prison and 17 years respectively, and the Supreme Court ruling on their appeal is set for Thursday.
South Korea's finance ministry plans to block a recommendation by a presidential commission for big conglomerates to participate in bank management.
